sub_title: Senior CRA, Health Innovation Student, MPharm
summary:
Multipotentialite, protagonist personality (Briggs Myers ENFJ-A). Endlessly curious and passionate to learn. A project manager by nature. 

I gravitate to work environments prioritizing empathy, service-oriented, visionary  leadership and egalitarian, merit-based work cultures. I strongly prefer long term, big picture strategic thinking. 

One could call me a pragmatic idealist, I aim to use my talents to initiatives that serve public good and enjoy being a part of a collective/company that embraces its role as tool of positive social movement. 


Professional interests: All things leadership mindset and management, digital health innovation, clinical research, operational efficiency, implementation science / change management

profile_positions.description:
Phase II - III studies. Oncology (MM, Lung Cancer NSCLC, pediatric progressive low grade glioma, Pediatric Allergic Rhinoconjuctivits, Gastrointestinal (Chron's disease, ulcerative colitis), Neuromuscular (SMA), Pulmonology (Sarcoidosis, Asthma)

Familiar with multiple EDC, eCOA, IRT/IWRS systems, eTMFs, CTMS systems, EPD systems

Acting as a direct contact with assigned sites, assessing and ensuring overall integrity of study implementation and adherence to study protocol at clinical sites. Problem-solving to address and resolve site issues. Ensuring timely and accurate completion of project goals and updating of applicable trial management systems. Work with team members to provide strategy for efficient project planning and goal completion, and encouraging the support of team members where required. Training more junior colleagues. Contributing to operational process improvements.
profile_positions.title: CRA (Clinical Research Associate / Clinical Site Manager)

profile_positions.description:
Phase II - III studies. Neurology (Alzheimer's, Cluster Headaches), Nephrology (Metabolic Acidosis)

Responsibilities:
- Implementing and monitoring clinical trials
- Assessing the qualifications of potential investigative sites
- Initiating trials at site
- CTMS and eTMF study related management 
- Site communication management
- Site staff training
- Resolving study related issues at site
- Providing regular study updates to project teams

Familiar with multiple eCOAs, IRT/IWRS systems, eTMFs, CTMS systems
profile_positions.title: CRA (Clinical Research Associate / Clinical Site Manager)

profile_positions.description:
Allucent (previously SMS - oncology --> CATO-SMS --> Allucent)

I, II phase studies / Oncology / DE, BE, NL, FR, IT

- Start up and submission communication and coordination with sites 
- Site initiation and activation activities
- Vendor management (Sample courier set up/ central lab logistics and contract set up /Setting up legal representation for EC in Switzerland, Contracting and set up of patient travel reimbursement vendors, Study questionnaire vendors, vendor validation process etc.)
- eTMF management (Veeva)
- Site logistics (lab kits, materials)


Internal CRA academy training : ICF/ GDPR/ GCP / PD's and CAPA's / Attended Remote Pre-Study Visits/ Attended Remote Site Initiation Visits Visits/ Attended on site Close Out Visits
profile_positions.title: CRA (Clinical Research Associate / Clinical Site Manager)

profile_positions.description:
I, II phase studies / Oncology (Acute Myeloid Leukemia / Multiple Myeloma) / DE, BE, NL, FR, CH, IT

o	Regulatory Affairs – Completion of site-specific documentation required for EC/IRB and CA/RA submissions per local and country requirement and document collection.
o	Site start up and activation.
o	Ensuring vendor access, collecting all start-up documentation required for activation, provision of lab kits, sponsor equipment etc.
o	Site initiation visits
o	Remote and risk-based monitoring
profile_positions.title: CRA Trainee (Clinical Research Associate Trainee)

profile_positions.description:
I, II phase studies / Oncology (Acute  Myeloid Leukemia / Multiple Myeloma/ Pancreatic carcinoma / Head & Neck carcinoma)  / DE, BE, NL, FR, CH, ES, IT, UK

Project management:
- Vendor management - scouting vendors, setting up vendors ( from initial contact to validation and agreement closure e.g.  Sample shipment couriers, Travel Reimbursment vendors, 
- Site budget set up per contracted scope for  DE, BE, NL, FR, UK

- Contract negotiation legal and financial ( Non-disclosure agreements, Clinical Trial Agreements, Vendor Agreements, Central Lab Agreements, Data Processing Agreements, Material Transfer Agreements)
- Audit preparation and follow up, drafting Corrective and Preventive Actions Plan post-audit.

- Quality assurance - interdepartmental collaboration to set up Standard operating procedure for site negotiation  and contracting optimize contracting workflows 
-Training CTA and Contracting colleagues

- Regulatory Affairs - Supported regulatory affairs department with completion of site-specific form required for EC/IRB and CA/RA submissions and document collection

- Project administration - Creating Investigator site files, compiling  Progress reports for  sponsors, managing Investigator payments, reviewing study documents for quality issues,  sponsor meeting documentation, arranging study document translation
profile_positions.title: Clinical Trial Assistant (CTA) and Site Contracting Associate - Oncology

profile_positions.description:
•	Supporting disease area specialists within the medical oncology department and head of country pharmacovigilance within the pharmacovigilance department

•	Executing all administrative tasks concerning provision of medication within the extended access program - pre-approval and compassionate use -  reviewing applications, communication with physicians, contract set up, arranging supply and shipping of medication, remote drug accountability, tracking patients and overall survival rates, compiled monthly reports for all sites for the medical dept. 

•	Compiling monthly SUSAR, individual case safety reports and other medical information for reporting to headquarters.
profile_positions.title: Administrator and logistic support associate - oncology

profile_positions.description:
As a part of a small and dedicated team I was responsible for for further growth  and development of the United POP Academy of music, media and the arts located in Amsterdam, an international branch of the Deutsche POP - providing Diploma & Bachelor degrees for the creative industry. My responsibilities involved scouting and contacting prospective clients and staff, advising, enrollments, issuing and amending contract agreements, administration, training new staff, organizing open day events etc.

•	Negotiated contracts with clients and helped reach quarterly sales goals
•	Resolved complex customer issues and assured appropriate contract changes
•	Fostered good continuous relationships with clients and promoted  values of the company through custom tailoring market events
•	Developed and optimized multiple internal workflow processes that enhanced efficiency and transparency between departments and externally to clients.
profile_positions.title: Sales, Contracts and Administration Officer | Student Advisor
